department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: John Kristoff joined the CTI faculty in the Fall of 1999.  He is currently a researcher with <a href='http://www.team-cymru.org'>Team Cymru</a>, an Internet security research think tank and heads up the <a href='http://iorc.depaul.edu'>Internet Operations Research Center (IORC)</a>.  He is a former employee of both the <a href='http://www.is.depaul.edu'>DePaul University Information Services Division</a> and the <a href='http://www.it.northwestern.edu'>Northwestern University Information Technology organization</a>, focusing on networking and security operations.  He also spent a couple years with <a href='http://www.ultradns.com'>UltraDNS (now part of Neustar)</a> involved in various special projects related to DNS and security.  In addition to occasionally teaching at DePaul he is currently seeking another B.S. degree, this time as a major in Mathematics at Northwestern University.
